page.title: 05THE SUMMERCOURT SHOP
page.content: The shop is situated at the crossroads on the main road, and has been open for three years but was closed for three years before the present owners bought it. The shop is a general store with an Off-Licence and they sell coal, paraffin, camera film, tobacco and there is a cold cabinet with meats and cheeses. The summer brings much more custom than the winter but it is difficult for parking being on the crossroads but there is a small park by the shop. There are only two workers in the shop its owners, Mr.and Mrs.Hall. Most of their winter custom is local but a lot of the village people do their main shopping elsewhere and just use the shop for oddments. They also take small adverts in the shop window making it a centre for the village community.
